column1: A biliary stricture is an abnormal narrowing of the common bile duct, the tube that moves bile from the liver to the small intestine.
A biliary stricture is often caused by injury to the bile ducts during surgery.

Other causes of this condition include: - Cancer of the bile duct - Damage and scarring due to a gallstone in the bile duct - Pancreatitis - Primary sclerosing cholangitis Risk factors include: - Gallstones - Injury to the intestines - Pancreatitis - Previous biliary surgery
The common bile duct will be rejoined with the small intestine.
Inflammation and narrowing of the biliary duct may return in some people.
